title: My first typeface
content:
Below is a link to an image of my first typeface. It is still being developed (obviously). I would love some input. Keep in mind I don't have them lined up perfectly on a baseline, but be ruthless.   
   
 [http://www.livejournal.com/users/shananicole/113500.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203333/http:/www.livejournal.com/users/shananicole/113500.html)
author: shananicole

comments.content: it looks similar to TimesNewRoman fo me ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203333im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I like it. Don't let the lack of constructive response on this board get you down.   
   
One suggestion. It looks as if the face's irregularities are one of its most interesting features. Have fun with that and take chances! There are a million and one boring serif fonts, and yet people continue to crank them out. Take a chance and make yours unique.

I love your lower case G the most. The lowercase y I enjoy as well.   
   
Like John said, keep going.

Hi Shana,   
   
I'm curious to see it, but it just loads some Snapfish logo when I view it with Safari or IE on Mac OS X.

\> _I'm curious to see it, but it just loads some Snapfish logo_   
\> _when I view it with Safari or IE on Mac OS X._   
   
Same thing happens using IE under Mac OS 9. I don't even see the Snapfish logo using Mozilla or Netscape 7. There doesn't seem to be any platform specific issues indicated in the help section of the [Snapfish](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203333/http:/www.snapfish.com/helpindex/t_=0) site.   
   
The only thing I can find is this note regarding [Viewing a Friend's Photos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203333/http:/www.snapfish.com/helpviewing#friend) - apparently you may have to be signed up for a Snapfish account to be able to view images hosted on the Snapfish site.   
   
The heck if I'm going to do that.   
   
Shana, could you just post a GIF or JPEG please?
